An element of a monoid is squarefree if the only squares that
divide it are the squares of units.

type: {R : Type u_1} → [inst : Monoid R] → R → Prop
name: Squarefree
docString:
An element of a monoid is squarefree if the only squares that
divide it are the squares of units.

An element in a commutative monoid is square-free if and only if the multiplicity of each non-unit divisor is at most 1.

type:
∀ {R : Type u_1} [inst : CommMonoid R] [inst_1 : DecidableRel Dvd.dvd] (r : R),
  Squarefree r ↔ ∀ (x : R), multiplicity x r ≤ 1 ∨ IsUnit x
name: multiplicity.squarefree_iff_multiplicity_le_one
docString: An element in a commutative monoid is square-free if and only if the multiplicity of each non-unit divisor is at most 1.

The theorem `Nat.squarefree_iff_nodup_factors` states that for any non-zero natural number `n`, `n` is squarefree if and only if the list of its prime factorization, `Nat.factors n`, has no duplicates. Here, a number is considered squarefree if the only squares that divide it are the squares of units. This theorem provides a characterization of squarefree numbers in terms of the uniqueness of their prime factors.

type: ∀ {n : ℕ}, n ≠ 0 → (Squarefree n ↔ n.factors.Nodup)
name: Nat.squarefree_iff_nodup_factors
docString: The theorem `Nat.squarefree_iff_nodup_factors` states that for any non-zero natural number `n`, `n` is squarefree if and only if the list of its prime factorization, `Nat.factors n`, has no duplicates. Here, a number is considered squarefree if the only squares that divide it are the squares of units. This theorem provides a characterization of squarefree numbers in terms of the uniqueness of their prime factors.

The special case of Graham's conjecture where all numbers are squarefree.

type: ∀ {n : ℕ} (f : ℕ → ℕ), (∀ k < n, Squarefree (f k)) → n.GrahamConjecture f
name: Nat.grahamConjecture_of_squarefree
docString: The special case of Graham's conjecture where all numbers are squarefree.

A natural number `n` is squarefree if and only if its prime factorization `Nat.factors n` has no repeating elements.

type: ∀ {n : ℕ}, n ≠ 0 → (Squarefree n ↔ n.factors.Nodup)
name: Nat.squarefree_iff_nodup_factors
docString: A natural number `n` is squarefree if and only if its prime factorization `Nat.factors n` has no repeating elements.

This theorem states that for any type `R` that forms a commutative monoid, and any element `x` of `R`, if `x` is irreducible then it is squarefree. In terms of mathematics, for a given irreducible element in a commutative monoid, the only squares that divide it are the squares of units. In other words, the element is squarefree if it cannot be divided by the square of any non-unit element.

type: ∀ {R : Type u_1} [inst : CommMonoid R] {x : R}, Irreducible x → Squarefree x
name: Irreducible.squarefree
docString: This theorem states that for any type `R` that forms a commutative monoid, and any element `x` of `R`, if `x` is irreducible then it is squarefree. In terms of mathematics, for a given irreducible element in a commutative monoid, the only squares that divide it are the squares of units. In other words, the element is squarefree if it cannot be divided by the square of any non-unit element.

If `n` is a squarefree natural number, then `-1` is a square modulo `n` if and only if
`n` is not divisible by a prime `q` such that `q % 4 = 3`.

type: ∀ {n : ℕ}, Squarefree n → (IsSquare (-1) ↔ ∀ {q : ℕ}, Nat.Prime q → q ∣ n → q % 4 ≠ 3)
name: ZMod.isSquare_neg_one_iff
docString:
If `n` is a squarefree natural number, then `-1` is a square modulo `n` if and only if
`n` is not divisible by a prime `q` such that `q % 4 = 3`.

The points in a cube with at least one projection equal to 0 or 1.

type: (N : Type u_1) → Set (N → ↑unitInterval)
name: Cube.boundary
docString: The points in a cube with at least one projection equal to 0 or 1.

`x * y` is square-free iff `x` and `y` have no common factors and are themselves square-free.

type:
∀ {R : Type u_1} [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero R] {x y : R} [inst_1 : DecompositionMonoid R],
  Squarefree (x * y) ↔ IsRelPrime x y ∧ Squarefree x ∧ Squarefree y
name: squarefree_mul_iff
docString: `x * y` is square-free iff `x` and `y` have no common factors and are themselves square-free.

Every nonzero natural number has a unique prime factorization

type: Set.InjOn Nat.factorization {x | x ≠ 0}
name: Nat.factorization_inj
docString: Every nonzero natural number has a unique prime factorization

A prime natural number is prime in `ℤ[i]` if and only if it is `3` mod `4`

type: ∀ (p : ℕ) [inst : Fact (Nat.Prime p)], Prime ↑p ↔ p % 4 = 3
name: GaussianInt.prime_iff_mod_four_eq_three_of_nat_prime
docString: A prime natural number is prime in `ℤ[i]` if and only if it is `3` mod `4`

The only numbers with empty prime factorization are `0` and `1`

type: ∀ (n : ℕ), n.factorization = 0 ↔ n = 0 ∨ n = 1
name: Nat.factorization_eq_zero_iff'
docString: The only numbers with empty prime factorization are `0` and `1`

If `n` is a squarefree natural number, then `-1` is a square modulo `n` if and only if
`n` has no divisor `q` that is `≡ 3 mod 4`.

type: ∀ {n : ℕ}, Squarefree n → (IsSquare (-1) ↔ ∀ {q : ℕ}, q ∣ n → q % 4 ≠ 3)
name: ZMod.isSquare_neg_one_iff'
docString:
If `n` is a squarefree natural number, then `-1` is a square modulo `n` if and only if
`n` has no divisor `q` that is `≡ 3 mod 4`.

If a prime `p` divides `n` such that `-1` is a square modulo `n`, then `p % 4 ≠ 3`.

type: ∀ {p n : ℕ}, Nat.Prime p → p ∣ n → IsSquare (-1) → p % 4 ≠ 3
name: Nat.Prime.mod_four_ne_three_of_dvd_isSquare_neg_one
docString: If a prime `p` divides `n` such that `-1` is a square modulo `n`, then `p % 4 ≠ 3`.

A separable polynomial is square-free.

See `PerfectField.separable_iff_squarefree` for the converse when the coefficients are a perfect
field.

type: ∀ {R : Type u} [inst : CommSemiring R] {p : Polynomial R}, p.Separable → Squarefree p
name: Polynomial.Separable.squarefree
docString:
A separable polynomial is square-free.

See `PerfectField.separable_iff_squarefree` for the converse when the coefficients are a perfect
field.

`ZMod n` is reduced iff `n` is square-free (or `n=0`).

type: ∀ {n : ℕ}, IsReduced (ZMod n) ↔ Squarefree n ∨ n = 0
name: isReduced_zmod
docString: `ZMod n` is reduced iff `n` is square-free (or `n=0`).

A **corner-free set** in an abelian group is a set containing no non-trivial corner.

type: {G : Type u_1} → [inst : AddCommMonoid G] → Set (G × G) → Prop
name: IsCornerFree
docString: A **corner-free set** in an abelian group is a set containing no non-trivial corner.

If `p` and `q` are distinct primes that are both congruent to `3` mod `4`, then `q` is
a square mod `p` iff `p` is a nonsquare mod `q`.

type:
∀ {p q : ℕ} [inst : Fact (Nat.Prime p)] [inst_1 : Fact (Nat.Prime q)],
  p % 4 = 3 → q % 4 = 3 → p ≠ q → (IsSquare ↑q ↔ ¬IsSquare ↑p)
name: ZMod.exists_sq_eq_prime_iff_of_mod_four_eq_three
docString:
If `p` and `q` are distinct primes that are both congruent to `3` mod `4`, then `q` is
a square mod `p` iff `p` is a nonsquare mod `q`.

An odd prime `p` is a square in `F` iff the quadratic character of `ZMod p` does not
take the value `-1` on `χ₄#F * #F`.

type:
∀ {F : Type u_1} [inst : Field F] [inst_1 : Fintype F],
  ringChar F ≠ 2 →
    ∀ {p : ℕ} [inst_2 : Fact (Nat.Prime p)],
      p ≠ 2 → (IsSquare ↑p ↔ (quadraticChar (ZMod p)) (↑(ZMod.χ₄ ↑(Fintype.card F)) * ↑(Fintype.card F)) ≠ -1)
name: FiniteField.isSquare_odd_prime_iff
docString:
An odd prime `p` is a square in `F` iff the quadratic character of `ZMod p` does not
take the value `-1` on `χ₄#F * #F`.

Any natural number power of a prime is deficient

type: ∀ {n m : ℕ}, Nat.Prime n → (n ^ m).Deficient
name: Nat.Prime.deficient_pow
docString: Any natural number power of a prime is deficient

Every non-zero prime ideal in a unique factorization domain contains a prime element.

type:
∀ {R : Type u_2} [inst : CommSemiring R] [inst_1 : IsDomain R] [inst_2 : UniqueFactorizationMonoid R] {I : Ideal R},
  I.IsPrime → I ≠ ⊥ → ∃ x ∈ I, Prime x
name: Ideal.IsPrime.exists_mem_prime_of_ne_bot
docString: Every non-zero prime ideal in a unique factorization domain contains a prime element.

`Fₙ = 2^(2^n)+1` is prime if `3^((Fₙ - 1)/2) = -1 mod Fₙ` (**Pépin's test**).

type: ∀ (n : ℕ), 3 ^ ((n.fermatNumber - 1) / 2) = -1 → Nat.Prime n.fermatNumber
name: Nat.pepin_primality'
docString: `Fₙ = 2^(2^n)+1` is prime if `3^((Fₙ - 1)/2) = -1 mod Fₙ` (**Pépin's test**).

A (positive) natural number `n` is a sum of two squares if and only if the exponent of
every prime `q` such that `q % 4 = 3` in the prime factorization of `n` is even.
(The assumption `0 < n` is not present, since for `n = 0`, both sides are satisfied;
the right hand side holds, since `padicValNat q 0 = 0` by definition.)

type: ∀ {n : ℕ}, (∃ x y, n = x ^ 2 + y ^ 2) ↔ ∀ {q : ℕ}, Nat.Prime q → q % 4 = 3 → Even (padicValNat q n)
name: Nat.eq_sq_add_sq_iff
docString:
A (positive) natural number `n` is a sum of two squares if and only if the exponent of
every prime `q` such that `q % 4 = 3` in the prime factorization of `n` is even.
(The assumption `0 < n` is not present, since for `n = 0`, both sides are satisfied;
the right hand side holds, since `padicValNat q 0 = 0` by definition.)

In a finite field of odd characteristic, not every element is a square.

type: ∀ {F : Type u_3} [inst : Field F] [inst_1 : Finite F], ringChar F ≠ 2 → ∃ a, ¬IsSquare a
name: FiniteField.exists_nonsquare
docString: In a finite field of odd characteristic, not every element is a square.
